verses.verse: And Jacob <WH3290> dwelt <WH3427> in the land <WH776> wherein his father <WH1> was a stranger <WH4033>, in the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667>. wherein: Heb. of his father's sojournings

These are the generations <WH8435> of Jacob <WH3290>. Joseph <WH3130>, being seventeen <WH6240> <WH7651> years <WH8141> old <WH1121>, was feeding <WH7462> the flock <WH6629> with his brethren <WH251>; and the lad <WH5288> was with the sons <WH1121> of Bilhah <WH1090>, and with the sons <WH1121> of Zilpah <WH2153>, his father's <WH1> wives <WH802>: and Joseph <WH3130> brought <WH935> unto his father <WH1> their evil <WH7451> report <WH1681>.

Now Israel <WH3478> loved <WH157> Joseph <WH3130> more than all his children <WH1121>, because he was the son <WH1121> of his old age <WH2208>: and he made <WH6213> him a coat <WH3801> of many colours <WH6446>. colours: or, pieces

And when his brethren <WH251> saw <WH7200> that their father <WH1> loved <WH157> him more than all his brethren <WH251>, they hated <WH8130> him, and could <WH3201> not speak <WH1696> peaceably <WH7965> unto him.
And Joseph <WH3130> dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472>, and he told <WH5046> it his brethren <WH251>: and they hated <WH8130> him yet the more <WH3254>.
And he said <WH559> unto them, Hear <WH8085>, I pray you, this dream <WH2472> which I have dreamed <WH2492>:

For, behold, we were binding <WH481> <WH8432> sheaves <WH485> in the field <WH7704>, and, lo, my sheaf <WH485> arose <WH6965>, and also stood upright <WH5324>; and, behold, your sheaves <WH485> stood round about <WH5437>, and made obeisance <WH7812> to my sheaf <WH485>.

And his brethren <WH251> said <WH559> to him, Shalt thou indeed <WH4427> reign <WH4427> over us? or shalt thou indeed <WH4910> have dominion <WH4910> over us? And they hated <WH8130> him yet the more <WH3254> for his dreams <WH2472>, and for his words <WH1697>.

And he dreamed <WH2492> yet another <WH312> dream <WH2472>, and told <WH5608> it his brethren <WH251>, and said <WH559>, Behold, I have dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472> more; and, behold, the sun <WH8121> and the moon <WH3394> and the eleven <WH6240> <WH259> stars <WH3556> made obeisance <WH7812> to me.

And he told <WH5608> it to his father <WH1>, and to his brethren <WH251>: and his father <WH1> rebuked <WH1605> him, and said <WH559> unto him, What is this dream <WH2472> that thou hast dreamed <WH2492>? Shall I and thy mother <WH517> and thy brethren <WH251> indeed <WH935> come <WH935> to bow down <WH7812> ourselves to thee to the earth <WH776>?
And his brethren <WH251> envied <WH7065> him; but his father <WH1> observed <WH8104> the saying <WH1697>.
And his brethren <WH251> went <WH3212> to feed <WH7462> their father's <WH1> flock <WH6629> in Shechem <WH7927>.

And Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, Do not thy brethren <WH251> feed <WH7462> the flock in Shechem <WH7927>? come <WH3212>, and I will send thee <WH7971> unto them. And he said <WH559> to him, Here am I.

And he said <WH559> to him, Go <WH3212>, I pray thee, see <WH7200> whether it be well <WH7965> with thy brethren <WH251>, and well <WH7965> with the flocks <WH6629>; and bring <WH7725> me word <WH1697> again <WH7725>. So he sent <WH7971> him out of the vale <WH6010> of Hebron <WH2275>, and he came <WH935> to Shechem <WH7927>. see: Heb. see the peace of thy brethren, etc.
And a certain man <WH376> found him <WH4672>, and, behold, he was wandering <WH8582> in the field <WH7704>: and the man <WH376> asked him <WH7592>, saying <WH559>, What seekest <WH1245> thou?
And he said <WH559>, I seek <WH1245> my brethren <WH251>: tell <WH5046> me, I pray thee, where <WH375> they feed <WH7462> their flocks.

And the man <WH376> said <WH559>, They are departed <WH5265> hence <WH2088>; for I heard <WH8085> them say <WH559>, Let us go <WH3212> to Dothan <WH1886>. And Joseph <WH3130> went <WH3212> after <WH310> his brethren <WH251>, and found <WH4672> them in Dothan <WH1886>.
And when they saw <WH7200> him afar off <WH7350>, even before he came near <WH7126> unto them, they conspired <WH5230> against him to slay <WH4191> him.
And they said <WH559> one <WH376> to another <WH251>, Behold, this <WH1976> dreamer <WH1167> <WH2472> cometh <WH935>. dreamer: Heb. master of dreams

Come <WH3212> now therefore, and let us slay <WH2026> him, and cast <WH7993> him into some <WH259> pit <WH953>, and we will say <WH559>, Some evil <WH7451> beast <WH2416> hath devoured <WH398> him: and we shall see <WH7200> what will become of his dreams <WH2472>.
And Reuben <WH7205> heard <WH8085> it, and he delivered <WH5337> him out of their hands <WH3027>; and said <WH559>, Let us not kill <WH5221> <WH5315> him.

And Reuben <WH7205> said <WH559> unto them, Shed <WH8210> no blood <WH1818>, but cast <WH7993> him into this pit <WH953> that is in the wilderness <WH4057>, and lay <WH7971> no hand <WH3027> upon him; that he might rid <WH5337> him out of their hands <WH3027>, to deliver <WH7725> him to his father <WH1> again <WH7725>.

And it came to pass, when Joseph <WH3130> was come <WH935> unto his brethren <WH251>, that they stript <WH6584> <WH853> Joseph <WH3130> out of <WH854> his coat <WH3801>, his coat <WH3801> of many colours <WH6446> that was on him; colours: or, pieces
And they took <WH3947> him, and cast <WH7993> him into a pit <WH953>: and the pit <WH953> was empty <WH7386>, there was no water <WH4325> in it.

And they sat down <WH3427> to eat <WH398> bread <WH3899>: and they lifted up <WH5375> their eyes <WH5869> and looked <WH7200>, and, behold, a company <WH736> of Ishmeelites <WH3459> came <WH935> from Gilead <WH1568> with their camels <WH1581> bearing <WH5375> spicery <WH5219> and balm <WH6875> and myrrh <WH3910>, going <WH1980> to carry it down <WH3381> to Egypt <WH4714>.
And Judah <WH3063> said <WH559> unto his brethren <WH251>, What profit <WH1215> is it if we slay <WH2026> our brother <WH251>, and conceal <WH3680> his blood <WH1818>?

Come <WH3212>, and let us sell <WH4376> him to the Ishmeelites <WH3459>, and let not our hand <WH3027> be upon him; for he is our brother <WH251> and our flesh <WH1320>. And his brethren <WH251> were content <WH8085>. were: Heb. hearkened

Then there passed <WH5674> by Midianites <WH4084> merchantmen <WH582> <WH5503>; and they drew <WH4900> and lifted up <WH5927> Joseph <WH3130> out of the pit <WH953>, and sold <WH4376> Joseph <WH3130> to the Ishmeelites <WH3459> for twenty <WH6242> pieces of silver <WH3701>: and they brought <WH935> Joseph <WH3130> into Egypt <WH4714>.
And Reuben <WH7205> returned <WH7725> unto the pit <WH953>; and, behold, Joseph <WH3130> was not in the pit <WH953>; and he rent <WH7167> his clothes <WH899>.
And he returned <WH7725> unto his brethren <WH251>, and said <WH559>, The child <WH3206> is not; and I, whither <WH575> shall I go <WH935>?
And they took <WH3947> Joseph's <WH3130> coat <WH3801>, and killed <WH7819> a kid <WH8163> of the goats <WH5795>, and dipped <WH2881> the coat <WH3801> in the blood <WH1818>;

And they sent <WH7971> the coat <WH3801> of many colours <WH6446>, and they brought <WH935> it to their father <WH1>; and said <WH559>, This have we found <WH4672>: know <WH5234> now whether it be thy son's <WH1121> coat <WH3801> or no.

And he knew it <WH5234>, and said <WH559>, It is my son's <WH1121> coat <WH3801>; an evil <WH7451> beast <WH2416> hath devoured <WH398> him; Joseph <WH3130> is without doubt <WH2963> rent in pieces <WH2963>.
And Jacob <WH3290> rent <WH7167> his clothes <WH8071>, and put <WH7760> sackcloth <WH8242> upon his loins <WH4975>, and mourned <WH56> for his son <WH1121> many <WH7227> days <WH3117>.

And all his sons <WH1121> and all his daughters <WH1323> rose up <WH6965> to comfort <WH5162> him; but he refused <WH3985> to be comforted <WH5162>; and he said <WH559>, For I will go down <WH3381> into the grave <WH7585> unto my son <WH1121> mourning <WH57>. Thus his father <WH1> wept <WH1058> for him.

And the Midianites <WH4092> sold <WH4376> him into Egypt <WH4714> unto Potiphar <WH6318>, an officer <WH5631> of Pharaoh's <WH6547>, and captain <WH8269> of the guard <WH2876>. officer: Heb. eunuch: but the word doth signify not only eunuchs, but also chamberlains, courtiers, and officers captain: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the slaughter men, or executioners
